nodes.bodyText: This duplicates the walk to get to the base component type.  Could the if (clazz.isHidden()) { check be moved after the existing loop to get the baseType?
Right, I didn't notice the following code is doing the same thing. It is fixed.

Can you add a comment to the method overall that indicates this needs to be kept in sync with the version in Class.java?
Eventually we should get rid of the duplication.... but a comment will cover this PR
Comment added.
This needs a null check on the return value
Fixed.

Can avoid the hardcoded constant (and doing the math) by using the LITERAL_STRLEN macro

        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		J9UTF8_DATA_EQUALS(getUTF8Data(superClassNameIndex), getUTF8Length(superClassNameIndex), "java/lang/Enum", 14) &&
          
          
            
            		J9UTF8_DATA_EQUALS(getUTF8Data(superClassNameIndex), getUTF8Length(superClassNameIndex), "java/lang/Enum", LITERAL_STRLEN("java/lang/Enum")) &&
Fixed.

Formatting nitpick - comment closer */ should line up with the other comment line starters

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            			/* isRAMClassCompatible() cannot find ram class of a hidden class, we are testing if 
          
          
            
            			 * the source class is the subclass of target class. We can use superclass of source class instead here. */
          
          
            
            			/* isRAMClassCompatible() cannot find ram class of a hidden class, we are testing if 
          
          
            
            			 * the source class is the subclass of target class. We can use superclass of source class instead here. 
          
          
            
            			 */
Fixed

Can a hidden class extend a hidden class?  I think not as it won't be findable to tell if the superclass has been loaded or not.  Assuming I'm right on that, can you add a comment to that effect here?
I agree with you. I don't think a class can extend a hidden class.
Comment added.
Why throw internal error if there's a perfectly good exception already pending?
I added this when debugging some tests where we missed to set an exception. This should be removed and it is removed now.

How did we get out of defineClass without a pending exception?  I think we need to find that path and ensure it sets an exception as required by the contract for defineClassCommon - either a class is found or it returns null with pending exception
It is fixed now. Directly return NULL when result is NULL.
Yes, always return null for the hidden classes simple name. Fixed as suggested.

Isn't this already covered by the J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION macro?

#define J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz) \
	((J9ROMCLASS_IS_UNSAFE((clazz)->romClass) && !J9ROMCLASS_IS_HIDDEN((clazz)->romClass)) || (J9_ARE_ANY_BITS_SET((clazz)->classFlags, J9ClassIsExemptFromValidation)))
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -157,12 +157,11 @@ performVerification(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9Class *clazz)
 		/* See if this class should be verified:
 		 *
 		 * - Do not verify any class created by sun.misc.Unsafe
-		 * - Do not verify hidden classes
 		 * - Do not verify any class which is marked for exclusion in the optional flags
 		 * - Verify every class whose bytecodes have been modified
 		 * - Do not verify bootstrap classes if the appropriate runtime flag is set
 		 */
-		if (((!J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz)) && !J9ROMCLASS_IS_HIDDEN(romClass))
+		if ((!J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz))

nodes.bodyText:
For hidden class, this macro returns FALSE.  so
The original code !J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz) && !J9ROMCLASS_IS_HIDDEN(romClass)
is TRUE && FLASE = FALSE.
Removing && !J9ROMCLASS_IS_HIDDEN(romClass), this condition becomes TRUE.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -157,12 +157,11 @@ performVerification(J9VMThread *currentThread, J9Class *clazz)
 		/* See if this class should be verified:
 		 *
 		 * - Do not verify any class created by sun.misc.Unsafe
-		 * - Do not verify hidden classes
 		 * - Do not verify any class which is marked for exclusion in the optional flags
 		 * - Verify every class whose bytecodes have been modified
 		 * - Do not verify bootstrap classes if the appropriate runtime flag is set
 		 */
-		if (((!J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz)) && !J9ROMCLASS_IS_HIDDEN(romClass))
+		if ((!J9CLASS_IS_EXEMPT_FROM_VALIDATION(clazz))

nodes.bodyText: Is this a general case we've been missing?  That applies across all releases?
Yes, I think it is a general case we are missing. A class implements an interface the same as its own name.
Why is this being done here rather than in cfreader?  Do we not have the context there?  Could we get it by passing another flag thru?

The checks added here (and their order) are all forced by hidden class tests, they expect certain type of exception/error. I think ClassReader is doing checks differently (or maybe in different order), using ClassReader results a different type of exception/error, which makes those tests fail.
I would rather this logic stay in the native cfreader.c implementation then duplicate it here as well.  Even if that means making additional native calls to do the processing with cfreader.
Ahh, I see. You mean cfreader.c

We may move the magicNum and version checks into cfreader.c, and call the native from here. I guess other checks like the descriptor of this class and whether this class is in the same package as the host class can still be here in the java level. All these checks are in java level here in RI.
Moved the magic number and class version checks into cfreader.c.
Why does this need the name here?  Can we pass the bytes thru to native cfreader.c implementation and let it handle the checks?

Why does this need the name here?

Because the new API JavaLangAccess.defineClass() added by openjdk to define hidden class takes className as a parameter, so we pass className to makeHiddenClassDefiner() which eventually calls JavaLangAccess.defineClass().
The checks for magic number and class version are moved into cfreader.c.
Inconsistent comment formatting - please combine them.
Comments combined.
Some kind of indenting is called for here.
I'd much prefer that the comments not appear inside the if condition.
Fixed indenting and moved the comment outside of the if check.
This file must end with a newline.

nodes.bodyText: Please reverse this code (i.e. do not use if (!something) then else).
Fixed

Should probably update j9clazz here to be the most current version if initializeClass is called.
j9clazz = J9_CURRENT_CLASS(j9clazz);
Added this line after initializeClass().
This won't work for discontiguous arrays.

In fact, it won't work at all (you're assuming you have VM access in a normal JNI native). Please use JNI critical instead. This will require changing checkClassBytes to not throw the exception (have a return code instead).
Updated to use GetPrimitiveArrayCritical().
This comment is odd - perhaps expliciity say that hidden classes simple name is NULL.
Fixed.
Fixed.

The contract on this function is that it can only return null if there is an exception pending.  That's why the old code did the checks in the order it did:

pending exception?  Yes, just return as the exception will be thrown when returning to Java
not pending and null?  Defensively throw InternalError as defineClassCommon didn't meet its contract
Recovered the original logic.

This needs to be moved before the if (NULL != classData) { or it's invalid to be looking at the objects in that block.  It's a pre-existing bug, not related to your changes but should be fixed while looking at this code
Moved this line before if (NULL != classData) {
Now that there's no real code in the forwarder, would it make sense to just make checkClassBytes native?
On second thought, how about moving the null and size = 0 check into the java wrapper code and remove it from the native code.
Actually, since you're already fetching the length in the native (for more than just the 0 check), it may as well stay in the native.
Changed checkClassBytes to native.
Please call readClassFileBytes inside if !NULL to avoid the double return.
Fixed.
Should throw OOM here.
Also, please try and have only one return per function - goto is fine.
Added OOM error and fixed the multiple return issue.
Can this not find the class name and return it as a string?  It saves trying to parse it out on the java side
If it returns the name though, you can still do the checks in Java without having to partially parse the classfile again
Please use J9UTF8_DATA_EQUALS here.
Done.
I think this could use J9UTF8_EQUALS
Done.
All this code can go away if the native returns the class name string

There are test cases that make thisClass not an instance of Type and the descriptor does not start with "L", these tests asserts ClassFormatError to be thrown.

Can you provide examples of the invalid thisClass values?  I can understand the "L" case but need clarification on the instanceof Type case and why it wouldn't be caught by the cfreader code (unless maybe we don't check it till staticverify runs?)

The test comment basically says this_class may be an invalid index or a valid index pointing to something else rather than Class_Info. For why cfreader does not catch that, I might need to dig into that later. Maybe the case as you said or maybe I was not passing in the correct combination of BCT_XXXX flags in my local change.
I see the second parameter of j9bcutil_readClassFileBytes() takes a function pointer, can I pass in a J9CfrClassFile struct ?
